doc.content: A judge will soon decide whether former Puppy World owner Machelle Martin's animal abuse trial is moved to another county. Attorneys questioned a panel of 40 people Tuesday on what they knew about Martin's case to determine whether she could get a fair trial, in light of the media coverage of her case. Martin is charged with 33 counts of animal abuse and neglect in connection with Puppy World, which closed in late January after Martin's business license was revoked by the state. Officials said the Ingram Mill Road store had failed several inspections. Martin's public defender Brady Musgrave asked Associate Greene County Circuit Judge Mark Fitzsimmons to relocate the trial, citing a high probability of a mistrial. He observed that 95 percent of the mock jury pool questioned Tuesday had heard of Martin's animal abuse case in some manner.
